intro: Ditassa lenheirensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming dense clusters of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
